description: Originated 1275–1325 from Middle English subdecon and -dekene, from Late Latin subdiāconus. See sub- + deacon.

entries.meaning: (Catholicism, chiefly historical) A Catholic clerical rank  in the major orders below that of a deacon.
(Catholicism, chiefly historical) A Catholic cleric who assists the deacon at High Mass and normally reads the Epistle at the Eucharist.
(Eastern Christianity) The highest of the minor orders below that of a deacon
